p: The strategy of using natural extracts as fish and seafood preservative agents is a response to the consumerâ€™s concern about synthetic additives and environmental impacts [ 171]. In general, for this type of application, both thyme essential oil and extracts are used for immersion (for 30 min, followed by drainage of the product) or applied to films or added to the surface of the fish (on both sides). Different studies on the use of thyme in fish and seafood have applied concentrations ranging from 0.1 to 3%. Another alternative is the inclusion of the EO in coatings and packaging films on seafood to contribute to their preservative effects.
